title: Content review handoff should include actual content in notes
description:
When agent signals CONTENT_REVIEW for content/copy review, the actual content to review is in the ephemeral agent output but NOT in the tick notes.

Example from fx9:
- Notes say: 'need approval on which option (A: simple, B: with value, C: friendly)'
- But the actual wording for A, B, C is only in the agent's stdout - not persisted

Problem: Human reviewer can't see what they're supposed to review without access to agent output logs.

Suggested fix options:
1. Agent prompt should instruct: 'When signaling CONTENT_REVIEW, include the content in the note'
2. Ticker could capture the context from the signal and add it to notes
3. CONTENT_REVIEW signal format could require content: <promise>CONTENT_REVIEW: [actual content here]</promise>

Current signal just has description, not the content itself.
notes: 2026-01-14 23:14 - [human] User feedback: This is likely a prompt issue. Ticker's agent system prompt should emphasize: 'When handing off to human for approval/review/content, include sufficient context in the note so human can make a decision without needing agent output logs.'
